ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Generates a spline scatter-line chart in code
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Generates a spline scatter-line chart in code. Uses the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#Custom%20Series%20(CustomRenderableSeries).html']CustomRenderableSeries[/url] type to demonstrate how to create your own series types. Here we implement a Cubic Spline line series with optional scatter points.
[b][i]Tips![/i][/b]
As well as Stroke, you can set [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Common%20RenderableSeries%20Properties.html']StrokeThickness[/url], [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Common%20RenderableSeries%20Properties.html']AntiAliasing[/url], [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Common%20RenderableSeries%20Properties.html']IsVisible[/url] properties to change how the series is rendered.[
You can add data-point markers to a line series using the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Point%20Marker%20API%20-%20BaseRenderableSeries.Pointmarker.html']PointMarker API[/url]. This is very performant and uses the same bitmap rendering as our Scatter-Charts.
